Question
========
What does the base pipe `|>` do in R?

Answerlist
----------
* It comments out code so it wonâ€™t run
* It automatically loads all tidyverse packages
* It passes the left-hand result as the first argument to the next function
* It only works inside loops

Solution
========
The base pipe `|>` takes the value on the left and feeds it as the first argument to the function on the right, helping you write readable sequences of steps.
